result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco Antonio Macias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.  Due to financial hardship, court waived all non-mandatory costs.
Obtain and maintain employment, school, or a combination of both.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of this sentence.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco Antonio Macias

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months STRAIGHT TIME in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA, cash bail to apply. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or 
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment, school, or a
          combination of both.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
     *   No firearms; weapons
     *   Due to financial hardship, court waived all non-mandatory costs.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expungement following the successful completion of this sentence.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights received and filed

Defendant Marco Antonio Macias in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Marco Antonio Macias in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco Antonio Macias in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marco Antonio Macias in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Recalled at 3:06 for reading of complaint.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marco Antonio Macias
Current: 2339 W Brown St, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 07-29-2015)
Prior: 2401 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-29-2015 at 01:30pm
